ID: CK351VS_00
From: Roselle Reyes <Roselle.Reyes@etoilegroup.com>
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
CC: Ralph Joudet <Ralph.Joudet@etoilegroup.com>

Subject: PRL Atlantis The Palm - Insurance Clause
--------------------------------------------------
CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن


Hi Hagop, 

 

Could you also advise on the below related to RL kiosk in Atlantis Hotel – The Palm.

 

Obligations of Tenant in respect of Insurance 

1. The Tenant shall procure and keep in force and effect at all times during the term of this Lease and any extension thereof, at the Tenant’s sole cost the following insurance cover, and all such insurance cover must be in accordance with all relevant laws and regulations of the United Arab Emirates:

metadata.doc_id: CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
1. The Tenant shall procure and keep in force and effect at all times during the term of this Lease and any extension thereof, at the Tenant’s sole cost the following insurance cover, and all such insurance cover must be in accordance with all relevant laws and regulations of the United Arab Emirates: 

1.1 Public and Products Liability insurance to cover legal liability for injury, illness or death to persons or for loss of or damage to Premises, including in each case claimants and defence costs, resulting from or incurred in connection with the business of the Tenant and/or the supply or provision of products by the Tenant in accordance with the law of the country. Such insurance shall provide a limit of indemnity of not less than United States Dollar One Million (USD 1,000,000), unless otherwise agreed in writing, arising out of or in connection with any one occurrence and shall be unlimited in any one period of insurance, except for products liability which may be subject to an aggregate limit in any one period of insurance. 

1.2 Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance to cover personal injuries and industrial illnesses (including death and including claimant’s and defence costs) to staff of the Tenant resulting from or occurring in connection with the business of the Tenant. Such insurance shall cover no less than the Tenant’s obligations under the Labour Laws or similar statutory insurance laws of the U.A.E. 

1.3 INTENTIONALLY DELETED.

metadata.doc_id: CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
1.2 Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance to cover personal injuries and industrial illnesses (including death and including claimant’s and defence costs) to staff of the Tenant resulting from or occurring in connection with the business of the Tenant. Such insurance shall cover no less than the Tenant’s obligations under the Labour Laws or similar statutory insurance laws of the U.A.E. 

1.3 INTENTIONALLY DELETED. 

1.4 Where necessary, Material Damage insurance to cover all aspects of the assets (fixed and moveable) of the Tenant whilst on the Landlord premises and the Tenant’s installations and improvements to the premises for their full new replacement value. Such insurance should include insurance for the perils of fire, lightning, aircraft, earthquake, explosion, riot and civil commotion, storm, tempest, flood, bursting and overflowing of water apparatus, theft and impact by any vehicle and for any such additional perils as the Landlord may deem necessary for the purposes of providing the Services. 

2. If the Landlord reasonably believes additional insurance is required either by way of wider cover or higher sums insured or higher limits of indemnity then this shall be taken out by the Tenant at its cost. 

3. All insurance policies and coverage provided by the Tenant shall: 

3.1 Recognize the insurances provided as primary and non-contributory over any insurance, self insurance, deductible or retention carried by the Landlord. 

3.2 Be placed with financially sound insurers acceptable to the Landlord.

metadata.doc_id: CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
3.1 Recognize the insurances provided as primary and non-contributory over any insurance, self insurance, deductible or retention carried by the Landlord. 

3.2 Be placed with financially sound insurers acceptable to the Landlord. 

3.3 Name the Landlord as Additional Insureds, including the parent, subsidiary and affiliated companies and joint-venture partners, their directors, officers, employees and agents. 

3.4 Waive subrogation rights against the Landlord. 

3.5 Contain a severability of interest clause. 

4. The insurance coverage and policy limits required will not mitigate the Tenant’s obligations to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Landlord for claims made or suits brought which result from or are in connection with the Tenant’s performance under this Agreement. 

5. At any time during the Term when the Tenant, its agent or contractors conduct any work at the Premises, Contractor's All Risk Insurance. The limit of liability under such policy shall be no less than one million US Dollars (US$1,000,000) in respect of each and every claim. 

6. The Landlord shall be entitled to a copy of the said policies of insurance together with copies of either the premium receipts or certificates from the insurers confirming receipt of premium as appropriate and from time to time upon demand to inspect the originals of the said insurance policies and to have produced to the Landlord satisfactory evidence that the same are in full force and effect.

metadata.doc_id: CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
6. The Landlord shall be entitled to a copy of the said policies of insurance together with copies of either the premium receipts or certificates from the insurers confirming receipt of premium as appropriate and from time to time upon demand to inspect the originals of the said insurance policies and to have produced to the Landlord satisfactory evidence that the same are in full force and effect. 

7. If the Tenant shall fail to effect and keep in force any of the insurances referred to in this exhibit, or any other insurance which the Tenant may be required to effect under the terms of the Lease, then and in any such case the Landlord may (without prejudice to any other remedy) effect and keep in force such insurance and pay such premium or premiums as may be necessary for that purpose and from time to time deduct the amount so paid by the Landlord from any monies due to which may become due to the Tenant, or recover the same as a debt from the Tenant.

 

Best regards,

 

Roselle Reyes 
Administration Coordinator I

From: Roselle Reyes

Subject: PRL Atlantis The Palm - Insurance Clause
Importance: High

 

Hi Hagop, 

 

Could you also advise on the below related to RL kiosk in Atlantis Hotel – The Palm.

 

Obligations of Tenant in respect of Insurance 

1. The Tenant shall procure and keep in force and effect at all times during the term of this Lease and any extension thereof, at the Tenant’s sole cost the following insurance cover, and all such insurance cover must be in accordance with all relevant laws and regulations of the United Arab Emirates: 

1.1 Public and Products Liability insurance to cover legal liability for injury, illness or death to persons or for loss of or damage to Premises, including in each case claimants and defence costs, resulting from or incurred in connection with the business of the Tenant and/or the supply or provision of products by the Tenant in accordance with the law of the country. Such insurance shall provide a limit of indemnity of not less than United States Dollar One Million (USD 1,000,000), unless otherwise agreed in writing, arising out of or in connection with any one occurrence and shall be unlimited in any one period of insurance, except for products liability which may be subject to an aggregate limit in any one period of insurance.

The Landlord shall be entitled to a copy of the said policies of insurance together with copies of either the premium receipts or certificates from the insurers confirming receipt of premium as appropriate and from time to time upon demand to inspect the originals of the said insurance policies and to have produced to the Landlord satisfactory evidence that the same are in full force and effect. 

7. If the Tenant shall fail to effect and keep in force any of the insurances referred to in this exhibit, or any other insurance which the Tenant may be required to effect under the terms of the Lease, then and in any such case the Landlord may (without prejudice to any other remedy) effect and keep in force such insurance and pay such premium or premiums as may be necessary for that purpose and from time to time deduct the amount so paid by the Landlord from any monies due to which may become due to the Tenant, or recover the same as a debt from the Tenant.

 

Best regards,

 

Roselle Reyes 
Administration Coordinator I

Subject: Re: PRL Atlantis The Palm - Insurance Clause
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Roselle,

It is fine to accept.

Only clause 3.2, I would recommend a minor amendment:

3.2   Be placed with financially sound insurers acceptable to the Landlord.

You don't want to change your insurer because of one location. As long as the insurer is reputable and financially sound, it should be enough.

Best Regards,
Hagop

chunks.text:
From: Roselle Reyes
Sent: Tuesday, 08 October, 2024 11:52 AM
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Ralph Joudet <Ralph.Joudet@etoilegroup.com>
Subject: PRL Atlantis The Palm - Insurance Clause
Importance: High

 

Hi Hagop,

 

Could you also advise on the below related to RL kiosk in Atlantis Hotel – The Palm.

 

Obligations of Tenant in respect of Insurance

1. The Tenant shall procure and keep in force and effect at all times during the term of this Lease and any extension thereof, at the Tenant’s sole cost the following insurance cover, and all such insurance cover must be in accordance with all relevant laws and regulations of the United Arab Emirates:

1.1 Public and Products Liability insurance to cover legal liability for injury, illness or death to persons or for loss of or damage to Premises, including in each case claimants and defence costs, resulting from or incurred in connection with the business of the Tenant and/or the supply or provision of products by the Tenant in accordance with the law of the country. Such insurance shall provide a limit of indemnity of not less than United States Dollar One Million (USD 1,000,000), unless otherwise agreed in writing, arising out of or in connection with any one occurrence and shall be unlimited in any one period of insurance, except for products liability which may be subject to an aggregate limit in any one period of insurance.

metadata.doc_id: CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
1.1 Public and Products Liability insurance to cover legal liability for injury, illness or death to persons or for loss of or damage to Premises, including in each case claimants and defence costs, resulting from or incurred in connection with the business of the Tenant and/or the supply or provision of products by the Tenant in accordance with the law of the country. Such insurance shall provide a limit of indemnity of not less than United States Dollar One Million (USD 1,000,000), unless otherwise agreed in writing, arising out of or in connection with any one occurrence and shall be unlimited in any one period of insurance, except for products liability which may be subject to an aggregate limit in any one period of insurance.

1.2 Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance to cover personal injuries and industrial illnesses (including death and including claimant’s and defence costs) to staff of the Tenant resulting from or occurring in connection with the business of the Tenant. Such insurance shall cover no less than the Tenant’s obligations under the Labour Laws or similar statutory insurance laws of the U.A.E.

1.3 INTENTIONALLY DELETED.

metadata.doc_id: CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
1.2 Workmen’s Compensation and Employer’s Liability insurance to cover personal injuries and industrial illnesses (including death and including claimant’s and defence costs) to staff of the Tenant resulting from or occurring in connection with the business of the Tenant. Such insurance shall cover no less than the Tenant’s obligations under the Labour Laws or similar statutory insurance laws of the U.A.E.

1.3 INTENTIONALLY DELETED.

1.4 Where necessary, Material Damage insurance to cover all aspects of the assets (fixed and moveable) of the Tenant whilst on the Landlord premises and the Tenant’s installations and improvements to the premises for their full new replacement value. Such insurance should include insurance for the perils of fire, lightning, aircraft, earthquake, explosion, riot and civil commotion, storm, tempest, flood, bursting and overflowing of water apparatus, theft and impact by any vehicle and for any such additional perils as the Landlord may deem necessary for the purposes of providing the Services.

2. If the Landlord reasonably believes additional insurance is required either by way of wider cover or higher sums insured or higher limits of indemnity then this shall be taken out by the Tenant at its cost.

3. All insurance policies and coverage provided by the Tenant shall:

3.1 Recognize the insurances provided as primary and non-contributory over any insurance, self insurance, deductible or retention carried by the Landlord.

3.2 Be placed with financially sound insurers acceptable to the Landlord.

metadata.doc_id: CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CK351VS - prl atlantis the palm - insurance clause\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
3.1 Recognize the insurances provided as primary and non-contributory over any insurance, self insurance, deductible or retention carried by the Landlord.

3.2 Be placed with financially sound insurers acceptable to the Landlord.

3.3 Name the Landlord as Additional Insureds, including the parent, subsidiary and affiliated companies and joint-venture partners, their directors, officers, employees and agents.

3.4 Waive subrogation rights against the Landlord.

3.5 Contain a severability of interest clause.

4. The insurance coverage and policy limits required will not mitigate the Tenant’s obligations to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Landlord for claims made or suits brought which result from or are in connection with the Tenant’s performance under this Agreement.

5. At any time during the Term when the Tenant, its agent or contractors conduct any work at the Premises, Contractor's All Risk Insurance. The limit of liability under such policy shall be no less than one million US Dollars (US$1,000,000) in respect of each and every claim.

6. The Landlord shall be entitled to a copy of the said policies of insurance together with copies of either the premium receipts or certificates from the insurers confirming receipt of premium as appropriate and from time to time upon demand to inspect the originals of the said insurance policies and to have produced to the Landlord satisfactory evidence that the same are in full force and effect.

chunks.text:
6. The Landlord shall be entitled to a copy of the said policies of insurance together with copies of either the premium receipts or certificates from the insurers confirming receipt of premium as appropriate and from time to time upon demand to inspect the originals of the said insurance policies and to have produced to the Landlord satisfactory evidence that the same are in full force and effect.

7. If the Tenant shall fail to effect and keep in force any of the insurances referred to in this exhibit, or any other insurance which the Tenant may be required to effect under the terms of the Lease, then and in any such case the Landlord may (without prejudice to any other remedy) effect and keep in force such insurance and pay such premium or premiums as may be necessary for that purpose and from time to time deduct the amount so paid by the Landlord from any monies due to which may become due to the Tenant, or recover the same as a debt from the Tenant.

 

Best regards,

 

Roselle Reyes
Administration Coordinator I

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> 
Sent: Thursday, 10 October, 2024 1:00 PM
To: Roselle Reyes <Roselle.Reyes@etoilegroup.com>
Cc: Ralph Joudet <Ralph.Joudet@etoilegroup.com>
Subject: Re: PRL Atlantis The Palm - Insurance Clause

 

This email originated outside the organization - be cautious, particularly with links or attachments. 
رسالة من مرسل خارجي - كن حذرًا مع الروابط والمرفقات

Dear Roselle,

 

It is fine to accept.

 

Only clause 3.2, I would recommend a minor amendment:

 

3.2   Be placed with financially sound insurers acceptable to the Landlord.
